data.title: Added tileoffset support to tilemap clases and fix positioning issues & improved CCScrollView with rubber/elastic effect
data.body: Ccoos2d-x Tilemap support was missing tile offset property, and was having issues on positioning some layers. This patch includes the new Tilemap property and fix the positioning offset.

data.title: Suggestion: optimize some interfaces such as: FileUtils,base64,gzip to avoid unnecessary memory alloc and copy.
V3: fixed Windows 10 UWP app manifest by correcting image asset paths
data.body:
V3: fixed Windows 10 UWP app manifest by correcting image asset paths. The latest update to Visual Studio 2015 identified that there were incorrect paths to the app image files.

Cleaned up include paths for all WINRT platforms

data.title: Inprove SpriteFrameCache::addSpriteFramesWithDictionary
data.body: - Moved initialization of image to an appropriate location, because it always called twice in SpriteFrameCache::addSpriteFramesWithFile()

data.title: Add missing override keyword
data.body:
This fixes the following clang warnings when building using Xcode 7.

```
UIEditBoxImpl-common.h:53:18: 'initWithSize' overrides a member function but is not marked 'override'
UIEditBoxImpl-common.h:55:18: 'setFont' overrides a member function but is not marked 'override'
...
```

data.title: Added ability to set default min/magnification filtering
data.body:
for 2D Textures and Font atlas.

The default min/magnification settings for rendering textures was GL_LINEAR, which blurred textures.  This allows the user to set the default filtering when creating textures.

data.title: Multi windows
data.body:
Resubmitting, because it needed to be rebased to some of the new changes on v3

(continue from https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/pull/14058)

data.title: Multi-window implementation
data.body:
WindowKey is used as a multiplatform identifier for windows.  For now it's a hash of the GLFWwindow pointer, but that can be changed.

DirectorContext encapsulates a "mini director" instance for each window.  There is still a central director which is responsible for updating each context.  Each context also has its own event manager, action manager, and scheduler.

To reduce the amount of code changes necessary for mobile, by default the first window created is the main window.  The main window is special; if it gets closed, it terminates the application.  There are special accessors to grab the "main"scheduler/eventmanager/actionmanager.  For certain tasks, especially async tasks, they need to schedule their callbacks on the main window, because the existence of the other windows is not guaranteed, unlike the main one.

The contexts work in a similar manner as opengl.  A context is set to be active (setContextAndLock) and then non-actve (unlock).  Doing so changes what gets returned by the getCurrentWindow call and the getCurrentScheduler/EventManager/ActionManager calls.  This allows nodes and virtually everything to not care which window it was created in.  Unless the node is transplanted into a new window/context, its getCurrentManagers functions will always return the same.  It also hides any window dependancy.  Almost everything outside of the director doens't know or care which window it was created in.

CCGLViewImpl-desktop.cpp required substantial changes.  The poll events function grabs all the events for all windows at once.  What we want to do is sort them by window and defer the execution of them until the correct context is active.  Otherwise, we'll be switching contexts rapidly while processing the polled events.  Thus, the callbacks all push std::functions onto a map, keyed to the correct window.

There are also a number of order of operation fixes and smaller miscelaneous changes that were required as a result of this feature.

cpp-empty-test has been extended to create 3 windows at launch to demonstrate the multi window functionality.

data.title: cocos2d-x v3.X  -> FlipY3D does not flip at Y center position
fix crash if csb file is broken
fix crash in LoadingBar
data.body: fix crash in LoadingBar if no sprite.

data.title: fix: web view crash in ios 6.x
data.body: Web view crashes on iOS 6.x devices because frame is zero.

data.title: Set focus for widgets
data.body: Automatically set focus for widgets if focus enabled.

data.title: Fix an issue that list view's Magnetic::CENTER is not working well when non-bounceable.
data.body: Centric magnetic list view is not working well around boundaries if it is non-bounceable. This is a fix for it.

data.title: filter 3D Touch force event at touchesMoved.
data.body:
The force of the touch event invokes touchesMoved in iPhone 6s/6s+.
So, single tap invokes touchesBegan and touchesMoved. 

This PR filters events that doesn't move x and y coordinates since prev event. Because of filtering force  touch event.

data.title: ActionManager memory leak
Extending SpriteFrameCache to read PolygonInfo from atlas plist file
data.body:
Extended SpriteFrameCache to read polygon info from atlas .plist file.
The polygon information is added to a sprite instead of quads when creating a sprite from a named sprite frame.
Polygon creation can be done offline using TexturePacker 4.0.0.
Works with auto batching.

data.title: allocator bug
update for light3d reader
data.body: https://github.com/dumganhar/ccs-res/pull/51

data.title: Homogenous shadows and strokes for system fonts.
data.body:
Please review and merge this commit which provides the following features.

The stroke and the shadow of a cocos2d::Label rendered using the system fonts
are now handled on cocos' side.

For Linux and Mac targets this commit enables the stroke and shadow features.

For Linux targets this commits fixes the color used to render system fonts.

For Mac targets this commit also fixes the font creation. Previously only the
font family was searched. Now we try to get the font with the provided name.

For iOS and Android targets this commit enables the stroke and the shadow on
the emojis.

Textures created with system fonts are now cached and reused if a new label
is requested with the same text and same font definition.
